gen:ReportedAttribute.com:Text: Goal 17. Strengthen the means of implementing and revitalizing the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development

17.1 Improve, in particular through international assistance to developing countries, the mobilization of domestic resources with a view to strengthening national capacities for the collection of taxes and other revenues
17.1.1 Total government revenue as a share of GDP, by source
focal point of the SDGs within the OBR
Proportion of government revenue in GDP
Administrative data of OBR revenue and ISTEEBU national accounts, 2014
The OBR is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
The OBR is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics assisting in planning and decision-making.
This indicator is relevant because it highlights the proportion of people victims of violence during a year.
Ratio of government revenue to GDP, expressed as a percentage
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
Goal 17. Strengthen the means of implementing and revitalizing the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development

17.1 Improve, in particular through international assistance to developing countries, the mobilization of domestic resources with a view to strengthening national capacities for the collection of taxes and other revenues
17.1.1 Total government revenue as a share of GDP, by source
focal point of the SDGs within the OBR
Proportion of government revenue in GDP
Administrative data of OBR revenue and ISTEEBU national accounts, 2014
The OBR is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
The OBR is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics assisting in planning and decision-making.
This indicator is relevant because it highlights the proportion of people victims of violence during a year.
Ratio of government revenue to GDP, expressed as a percentage
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
Goal 17. Strengthen the means of implementing and revitalizing the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development

17.1 Improve, in particular through international assistance to developing countries, the mobilization of domestic resources with a view to strengthening national capacities for the collection of taxes and other revenues
17.1.2 Proportion of the national budget financed by national taxes
SDG focal point within the Ministry
This is the percentage of the general state budget financed by own resources
Administrative data of OBR revenue and ISTEEBU national accounts, 2017
The OBR is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
The OBR is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics assisting in planning and decision-making.
This indicator is relevant because it highlights the proportion of people victims of violence during a year.
Ratio between own resources and the general state budget, expressed as a percentage
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
Goal 17. Strengthen the means of implementing and revitalizing the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development
17.3 Mobilize additional financial resources from various sources for developing countries
17.3.1 Foreign direct investment, official development assistance and South-South cooperation, as a proportion of the total national budget
SDG focal point within the CNCA
These are foreign direct investments, official development assistance and South-South cooperation, as a proportion of the total national budget.
CNCA, Report on official development assistance flows, 2014-2015
The CNCA is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
The CNCA is the body recognized by the Burundian government
This indicator is relevant because it highlights foreign investments, public aid for development and South_South cooperation, compared to the national budget.
These are foreign direct investments, official development assistance and South-South cooperation, as a proportion of the total national budget.
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
Goal 17. Strengthen the means of implementing and revitalizing the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development
17.3 Mobilize additional financial resources from various sources for developing countries
17.3.2 Volume of migrant worker remittances (in United States dollars) as a share of total GDP
Bank of the Republic of Burundi (BRB)
SDG focal point within the BRB
Volume of migrant worker remittances (in US dollars) as a share of total GDP
Financial database of the Bank of the Republic of Burundi and ISTEEBU, Economic Accounts of Burundi, 2014
The BRB is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
The BRB is the body recognized by the Burundian government
Volume of migrant worker remittances (in US dollars) as a share of total GDP
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
Goal 17. Strengthen the means of implementing and revitalizing the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development

17.4 Assist developing countries in securing long-term debt sustainability through concerted policies to promote debt financing, debt relief or restructuring, as appropriate, and reduce debt distress by addressing the debt problem. external debt of heavily indebted poor countries
17.4.1 Debt service as a proportion of exports of goods and services
Bank of the Republic of Burundi (BRB)
SDG focal point within the BRB
External debt service as a proportion of exports of goods and services
The Bank of the Republic of Burundi, financial database
The BRB is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
The BRB is the body recognized by the Burundian government
External debt service as a proportion of exports of goods and services
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
Goal 17. Strengthen the means of implementing and revitalizing the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development

17.6 Strengthen access to science, technology and innovation and North-South and South-South cooperation and triangular regional and international cooperation in these fields and improve the sharing of knowledge according to agreed terms and conditions. common agreement, including through better coordination of existing mechanisms, in particular at the level of United Nations organizations, and within the framework of a global technology facilitation mechanism
17.6.1 Number of scientific and technological cooperation agreements and programs between countries, by type of cooperation
SDG focal point within the Ministry
Number of scientific and technological cooperation agreements and programs between countries, by type of cooperation
Ministry of Foreign Affairs, annual report 2016
The Ministry is responsible for compiling this indicator
List of scientific and technological cooperation agreements and programs between countries, by type of cooperation
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
Goal 17. Strengthen the means of implementing and revitalizing the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development

17.6 Strengthen access to science, technology and innovation and North-South and South-South cooperation and triangular regional and international cooperation in these fields and improve the sharing of knowledge according to agreed terms and conditions. common agreement, including through better coordination of existing mechanisms, in particular at the level of United Nations organizations, and within the framework of a global technology facilitation mechanism
17.6.1 Number of scientific and technological cooperation agreements and programs between countries, by type of cooperation
SDG focal point within the Ministry
Number of scientific and technological cooperation agreements and programs between countries, by type of cooperation
Ministry of Foreign Affairs, annual report 2016
The Ministry is responsible for compiling this indicator
List of scientific and technological cooperation agreements and programs between countries, by type of cooperation
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
Goal 17. Strengthen the means of implementing and revitalizing the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development

17.8 Ensure that the technology bank and the mechanism for strengthening the scientific and technological capacities and the innovation capacities of the least developed countries are fully operational by 2017 and strengthen the use of key technologies, in particular IT and communications
17.8.1 Proportion of the population using the Internet
Burundi Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies (ISTEEBU)
Social studies and statistics and poverty monitoring (ESSSP)
Percentage of the population who used the Internet in the past 12 months
Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
New data is data from EICVMB 2019_2020
ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.

This indicator is relevant because it highlights the difference between the crude birth rate and the crude death rate. It measures the increase of a population over a period of time due only to births and deaths
Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive. The indicator cannot be calculated by gender.
Proportion of the population at risk of criminal violence in the past 12 months
The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
The indicator is available at national level, province, area of residence (Total; Women; Men; Urban area; Rural area)
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
Goal 17. Strengthen the means of implementing and revitalizing the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development
17.17 Encourage and promote public partnerships, public-private partnerships and partnerships with civil society, building on the experience acquired and the funding strategies applied in this area
17.17.1 Amount (in United States dollars) of resources allocated to public-private partnerships and partnerships with civil society
Goal 17. Strengthen the means of implementing and revitalizing the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development
17.17 Encourage and promote public partnerships, public-private partnerships and partnerships with civil society, building on the experience acquired and the funding strategies applied in this area
17.17.1 Amount (in United States dollars) of resources allocated to public-private partnerships and partnerships with civil society
Goal 17. Strengthen the means of implementing and revitalizing the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development

17.19 By 2030, build on existing initiatives to establish indicators of progress in sustainable development that would complement gross domestic product, and support statistical capacity building in developing countries
17.19.1 Value (in dollars) of all resources allocated to statistical capacity building in developing countries
Social studies and statistics and poverty monitoring (ESSSP)
Value (in dollars) of all resources allocated to strengthening the statistical capacity of the national statistical system
ISTEEBU, Country report on support to statistics (CRESS), 2016
ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
Value (in dollars) of all resources allocated to strengthening the statistical capacity of the national statistical system
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
ISTEEBU, Country report on support to statistics (CRESS), 2016
Goal 17. Strengthen the means of implementing and revitalizing the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development

17.19 By 2030, build on existing initiatives to establish indicators of progress in sustainable development that would complement gross domestic product, and support statistical capacity building in developing countries

17.19.2 Proportion of countries that a) have conducted at least one population and housing census in the past 10 years, and b) have achieved a birth registration rate of 100% and a birth registration rate 80% deaths
Social studies and statistics and poverty monitoring (ESSSP)
ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive. The indicator cannot be calculated by gender.
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level

Goal 17. Strengthen the means of implementing and revitalizing the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development

17.18 By 2020, provide increased support for capacity building in developing countries, including least developed countries and small island developing States, with the goal of having much more data available for quality, up-to-date and accurate, disaggregated by income level, sex, age, race, ethnicity, migration status, disability and geographic location, and other country specific characteristics

17.18.1 Proportion of sustainable development indicators established at the national level, broken down exhaustively according to the target in accordance with the Fundamental Principles of Official Statistics
Social studies and statistics and poverty monitoring (ESSSP)
This is the percentage of indicators prioritized at the national level compared to all the SDG implementation indicators set at the international level.
Ratio between the number of prioritized indicators and the total of SDG indicators, multiplied by 100
Goal 17. Strengthen the means of implementing and revitalizing the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development

17.9 Provide increased support at the international level to ensure the effective and targeted capacity building of developing countries and thus support national plans aimed at achieving all the sustainable development objectives, in particular within the framework of North-South cooperation. South and South-South and triangular cooperation
17.9.1 Dollar value of financial and technical assistance pledged to developing countries (particularly in the framework of North-South and South-South cooperation and triangular cooperation)

17.12 Allow all least developed countries rapid access to duty-free and quota-free markets, in accordance with decisions of the World Trade Organization, including by ensuring that preferential rules applicable to imports from least developed countries less developed are transparent and straightforward and facilitate market access
17.12.1 Average tariffs applied to developing countries, least developed countries and small island developing States

17.16.1 Number of countries reporting progress in establishing multi-stakeholder development effectiveness monitoring frameworks that promote the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals

Goal 17. Strengthen the means of implementing and revitalizing the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development

17.2 Ensure that developed countries honor all their official development assistance commitments, including the commitment made by many to devote 0.7 percent of their gross national income to aid to developing countries and between 0.15 percent and 0.20 percent for aid to least developed countries, with donors encouraged to consider setting a target of spending at least 0.20 percent of their gross national income helping the least developed countries

17.2.1 Net official development assistance, total amount and amount allocated to least developed countries, as a proportion of gross national income (GNI) of donor countries members of the Development Assistance Committee of the Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)
Goal 17. Strengthen the means of implementing and revitalizing the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development

17.18.2 Number of countries with national statistics legislation in line with the basic principles of official statistics
Social studies and statistics and poverty monitoring (ESSSP)
Confirmation or denial of the existence of the legislation
ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level

17.7.1 Total amount of funding approved for developing countries for the promotion of the development, transfer and diffusion of environmentally friendly technologies

Goal 17. Strengthen the means of implementing and revitalizing the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development

17.18 By 2020, provide increased support for capacity building in developing countries, including least developed countries and small island developing States, with the goal of having much more data available for quality, up-to-date and accurate, disaggregated by income level, sex, age, race, ethnicity, migration status, disability and geographic location, and other country specific characteristics
17.18.3 Number of countries with a fully funded national statistical plan under implementation, by source of funding
Social studies and statistics and poverty monitoring (ESSSP)
Specify if the country has an NSDS in progress and whose funding is 100% available
The snds exists but it is not fully funded
Confirm or deny the existence of a fully funded NSDS

Goal 17. Strengthen the means of implementing and revitalizing the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development
17.14 Strengthen the coherence of sustainable development policies
17.14.1 Number of countries that have put in place mechanisms to strengthen policy coherence for sustainable development
